Location of the Site The Site is located in the Maple Springs Estate, North Region and is bounded by Oak Avenue to the North, Pine Road to the East, Maple Lane to the South, and the Riverfront Drive to the West. 2. Description of the Project Maple Springs Estate – Repair and Strengthening Works – Package 1 includes a total of 17 Buildings in the area designated in the tender drawings. The typical buildings are of 3 Types as follows: Building Type A: Number of buildings 5 Buildings Number of Floors per Building G+2 Floors Total Built up Area per Building 3500 SQ.M. Building Type B: Number of buildings 8 Buildings Number of Floors per Building G+3 Floors Total Built up Area per Building 4200 SQ.M. Building Type C: Number of buildings 4 Buildings Number of Floors per Building G+4 Floors Total Built up Area per Building 4800 SQ.M. Structural repair, façade strengthening, and external hardscaping around the buildings are part of the Contract. 3. BCA Code of Practice for Structural Works - Singapore Standard (SS) 550: Code of Practice for Concrete Structures - LTA Guidelines for Access and Traffic Management (where applicable) - Workplace Safety and Health Act (WSHA) 1.8 Tender Closing Date and Time 23 February 2026, 4:00 PM (Singapore Time) 1.9 Submission Address Electronic submission via BCA’s e‑Tender portal. Hard‑copy submissions, if any, shall be addressed to: | Item | Details | |---------------------|-------------------------------------------| | Tender Office | Building and Construction Authority | | Address | 10 Pasir Panjang Road, #12‑01, Singapore | | Email | procurement@bca.gov.sg | | Contact Person | Ms. Lian Wei Tan, Senior Procurement Officer | --- Page 3 --- Maple Springs Estate Structural Strengthening & Concrete Repair Project | Tender Ref: BCA/U5819/MPSE/2025/01 Building and Construction Authority (BCA) | Generated on 18 Nov 2025 | Page 3 2. SCOPE OF WORK 2.1 Civil & Structural - Inspection and assessment of existing structural elements. - Design of reinforcement solutions in compliance with SS 550. - Execution of concrete repair, steel reinforcement installation, and post‑tensioning where required. 2.2 Architectural - Repair of façade cladding, window frames, and external finishes. - Restoration of internal wall finishes and ceiling systems affected by structural remediation. 2.3 Mechanical & Electrical (M&E) - Re‑routing of services impacted by structural works. - Re‑commissioning of affected fire alarm, lighting, and HVAC systems. 2.4 Site Works - Temporary works design and installation (shoring, propping). - Traffic and pedestrian management in accordance with LTA guidelines. - Site housekeeping and waste disposal as per BCA environmental requirements. 3. CONTRACTUAL CONDITIONS 3.1 Contract Type Fixed Price – Remeasurable. The Contractor shall be paid a fixed sum for the defined scope. Any variations arising from unforeseen conditions shall be measured and valued in accordance with the Schedule of Rates annexed to the contract. 3.2 Payment Terms - Mobilisation Advance: 10% of contract value upon issuance of Letter of Acceptance. - Monthly Progress Payments: Based on measured work and approved interim certificates. - Final Payment: Upon issuance of Practical Completion Certificate and final account settlement. 3.3 Performance Security A performance bond of 5% of the contract value shall be submitted within 14 days of contract award. 3.4 Insurance Requirements - Contractor’s All Risks (CAR) policy covering the full contract value. - Public Liability Insurance minimum SGD 10,000,000 per occurrence. 3.5 Dispute Resolution Any dispute shall be referred to mediation under the Singapore Mediation Centre Rules, followed by arbitration under the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) Rules if unresolved. 4. EVALUATION CRITERIA 5.1 Technical Evaluation (60%) - Compliance with Scope of Works (20%) - Relevant Project Experience (15%) - Methodology and Programme (15%) - Quality Assurance & Safety Plan (10%) 5.2 Commercial Evaluation (40%) - Fixed Price Offer (30%) - Unit Rates for Remesurable Items (10%) 6. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION 6.1 Site Visit A mandatory site walk‑through will be conducted on 15 January 2026 at 10:00 AM. Registration is required via the e‑Tender portal. 6.2 Clarifications All queries must be submitted in writing through the e‑Tender portal by 30 January 2026, 5:00 PM. Responses will be issued on 5 February 2026. 6.3 Confidentiality All information contained in this tender document is confidential and must not be disclosed to any third party without prior written consent from BCA. SCOPE OF WORKS 2.1 Structural Repairs & Strengthening – Assessment and remedial works to reinforced concrete elements in accordance with BCA Standard SS EN 1992‑1‑1. – Installation of additional steel bracing as per BCA Structural Design Guide SG‑03. 2.2 Architectural Works – Repair of façade cladding, windows and doors to meet BCA Standard SS EN 1368. – Re‑painting of external surfaces using BCA‑approved low‑VOC paints (SS 166). 2.3 Mechanical & Electrical – Replacement of corroded conduit and cable trays in compliance with BCA Standard SS 544. – Testing and commissioning of temporary power supply as per BCA Electrical Installation Code. 2.4 Site Safety & Environmental Management – Implementation of a Site Safety Plan in line with BCA Safety Guidelines SG‑01. – Waste management and recycling plan adhering to Singapore Environmental Protection and Management Act. 3. TENDER SUBMISSION 3.1 Language: All tender documents must be submitted in English. 3.2 Format – Tender Form (Annex A) completed in full. – Technical Proposal (Annex B) – including methodology, programme and compliance statements. – Commercial Proposal (Annex C) – price breakdown as per the Bill of Quantities. – Supporting Documents (Annex D) – licences, qualifications, relevant project references. 3.3 Submission Method – Electronic submission via BCA e‑Tender portal (https://etender.bca.gov.sg) no later than the Closing --- Page 3 --- Maple Springs Estate Structural Strengthening & Concrete Repair Project | Tender Ref: BCA/U5819/MPSE/2025/01 Building and Construction Authority (BCA) | Generated on 18 Nov 2025 | Page 3 Date and Time. – Hard copy submission (optional) to: BCA Procurement Office, 10 Pasir Panjang Road, #05‑01, Singapore 117438. 3.4 Tender Security – A bid bond of 2 % of the Contract Value (SGD 9,000) to be submitted in the form of a bank guarantee or insurance bond, valid for 90 days from the Closing Date. 4. EVALUATION CRITERIA 4.1 Technical Evaluation (70 %) – Compliance with BCA standards and specifications (30 %). – Methodology and programme feasibility (20 %). – Relevant experience and past performance (20 %). 4.2 Commercial Evaluation (30 %) – Price competitiveness. – Payment terms and financial stability. 5. CONTRACTUAL REQUIREMENTS 5.1 Form of Contract: BCA Standard Form of Contract for Repair and Strengthening Works (SC‑RSW‑2023). 5.2 Insurance – Contractor’s All Risks (CAR) insurance covering the full contract sum. – Public Liability insurance with a minimum limit of SGD 5,000,000. 5.3 Performance Bond – A performance bond equal to 10 % of the Contract Value (SGD 45,000) to be furnished within 10 working days of Letter of Acceptance. 5.4 Liquidated Damages – SGD 500 per calendar day for delay beyond the agreed completion date, subject to a maximum of 30 days. 5.5 Dispute Resolution – Any dispute arising shall be referred to the Singapore International Arbitration Centre (SIAC) for arbitration in accordance with the SIAC Rules. 6. TENDERER’S DECLARATIONS 6.1 Conflict of Interest – Tenderer must declare any actual or potential conflict of interest. 6.2 Confidentiality – All information supplied in the tender documents shall be treated as confidential and used solely for the purpose of preparing the tender. 6.3 Compliance – Tenderer affirms compliance with all applicable Singapore laws, regulations and BCA guidelines. 7. Scope of Works 2.1 Civil & Structural - Earthworks, site preparation and ground improvement. - Reinforced concrete foundations, pile caps and grade beams in accordance with BCA Code of Practice. - Structural frame – columns, beams, slabs and roof structure to meet SS 550 and SS 636 requirements. - External works including retaining walls, stormwater drainage and site grading. 2.2 Architectural - Block‑and‑slab construction, internal partition walls and fire‑rated assemblies. - External façade, cladding and window systems compliant with BCA and SS 550. - Finishes – floor, wall and ceiling treatments, doors, fittings and fixtures. - Accessibility provisions in line with Singapore Building Regulations. 2.3 Mechanical - Centralised HVAC plant with VAV distribution, ductwork and controls. - Plumbing & drainage, including wet and dry services, sanitary fixtures and water reticulation. - Fire‑fighting system – sprinkler, hydrant and alarm network per SS 638. - Gas distribution and building management system (BMS) integration. 2.4 Electrical - Power distribution network, main switchgear and sub‑feeders. - Lighting, earthing and bonding in accordance with SS 638. - Low‑voltage systems – data, telecom, CCTV, access control and public address. - Renewable energy integration (solar PV) where feasible. 2.5 External Works - Road widening, footpaths and vehicular access complying with LTA guidelines. - Landscaping, site lighting and external drainage. - Utility diversion and connection to existing municipal services. --- Page 3 --- Greenfield Terrace Redevelopment | Tender Ref: T-2025/0-22-1234 Housing & Development Board (HDB) | Generated on 14 Nov 2025 | Page 3 3. Standards & Regulations - Building and Construction Authority (BCA) Singapore Building Regulations. - Relevant Singapore Standards (SS) for structural, mechanical, electrical and fire safety works. - Land Transport Authority (LTA) requirements for road and utility interfaces. - Fire Safety Act, Workplace Safety and Health Act and related codes of practice. 4. Deliverables - Complete set of design drawings (architectural, structural, M&E). - Bill of Quantities (BOQ) and detailed cost breakdown. - Construction programme (Gantt chart) covering the 36‑month period. - Quality Assurance Plan, Safety Management Plan and Environmental Management Plan. - As‑built documentation, testing & commissioning reports and Occupancy Permit. 5. DEFINITIONS 1.1 “Procuring Authority” means the Housing & Development Board (HDB). 1.2 “Contractor” means the successful tenderer of Tender Reference T‑2025/0‑22‑1234. 1.3 “Project” refers to the Residential Development at Woodlands Avenue 1. 1.4 “Contract Price” means the sum of SGD 150,000,000 inclusive of GST. 1.5 “Commencement Date” means the date on which the Contractor receives the Notice to Commence. 1.6 “Completion Date” means the date by which the Contractor shall achieve practical completion, being 36 months from the Commencement Date. 2. SCOPE OF WORKS 2.1 The Contractor shall design, supply, install, test and commission all works required for the Residential Development in accordance with the Drawings, Specifications and the Singapore Building and Construction Authority (BCA) Code of Practice. 2.2 The works include, but are not limited to, civil, structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical, plumbing, fire protection and external works. 3. Scope of Works 2.1 Civil & Structural - Earthworks, site preparation and ground improvement. - Reinforced concrete foundations, pile caps and grade beams in accordance with BCA Code of Practice. - Structural frame – columns, beams, slabs and roof structure to meet SS 550 and SS 636 requirements. - External works including retaining walls, stormwater drainage and site grading. 2.2 Architectural - Block‑and‑slab construction, internal partition walls and fire‑rated assemblies. - External façade, cladding and window systems compliant with BCA and SS 550. - Finishes – floor, wall and ceiling treatments, doors, fittings and fixtures. - Accessibility provisions in line with Singapore Building Regulations. 2.3 Mechanical - Centralised HVAC plant with VAV distribution, ductwork and controls. - Plumbing & drainage, including wet and dry services, sanitary fixtures and water reticulation. - Fire‑fighting system – sprinkler, hydrant and alarm network per SS 638. - Gas distribution and building management system (BMS) integration. 2.4 Electrical - Power distribution network, main switchgear and sub‑feeders. - Lighting, earthing and bonding in accordance with SS 638. - Low‑voltage systems – data, telecom, CCTV, access control and public address. - Renewable energy integration (solar PV) where feasible. 2.5 External Works - Road widening, footpaths and vehicular access complying with LTA guidelines. - Landscaping, site lighting and external drainage. - Utility diversion and connection to existing municipal services. --- Page 3 --- Greenfield Terrace Redevelopment | Tender Ref: T-2025/0-22-1234 Housing & Development Board (HDB) | Generated on 14 Nov 2025 | Page 3 3. Standards & Regulations - Building and Construction Authority (BCA) Singapore Building Regulations. - Relevant Singapore Standards (SS) for structural, mechanical, electrical and fire safety works. - Land Transport Authority (LTA) requirements for road and utility interfaces. - Fire Safety Act, Workplace Safety and Health Act and related codes of practice. 4. Applicable Standards: All works shall comply with the Building and Construction Authority (BCA) Code of Practice 2013, Singapore Standard (SS) 554 – Code of Practice for Structural Design, LTA Design Guidelines for Road Works, and any other relevant statutory requirements. 2. SCOPE OF WORKS 2.1. Civil & Structural 2.1.1. Earthworks – excavation, backfilling, compaction and disposal in accordance with BCA Guidelines. 2.1.2. Foundations – pile caps, raft foundations and reinforced concrete footings as per SS 554. 2.1.3. Superstructure – reinforced concrete frame, slab-on-grade, and precast elements where indicated. 2.1.4. Structural Steel – supply and erection of steel columns, beams and bracings in compliance with BCA Structural Steel Code. 2.2. Architectural 2.2.1. External Envelope – façade system, cladding, windows and doors meeting BCA Fire Code and SS 553. 2.2.2. Internal Finishes – partitions, floor finishes, ceiling systems, and wall finishes as per the Architectural Drawings (Appendix B). 2.2.3. Accessibility – provision of ramps, lifts and tactile guidance complying with the Code on Accessibility in the Built Environment. 2.3. Mechanical & Electrical 2.3.1. Mechanical Services – HVAC systems, plumbing, drainage and fire protection installations in accordance with SS 638 and SS 553. 2.3.2. Electrical Services – power distribution, lighting, earthing and bonding, data and --- Page 3 --- Greenfield Terrace Redevelopment | Tender Ref: T-2025/0-22-1234 Housing & Development Board (HDB) | Generated on 14 Nov 2025 | Page 3 telecommunications cabling as per SS 638 and LTA Electrical Standards. 2.3.3. Testing & Commissioning – full functional testing, balancing and certification prior to handover. 2.4. External Works 2.4.1. Roadworks – construction of access roads, kerbing and paving to LTA specifications. 2.4.2. Landscaping – planting, irrigation and site beautification as per HDB Landscape Guidelines. 2.4.3. Utilities – diversion, reinstatement and connection of water, gas, electricity and telecommunication services. 3. TENDER SUBMISSION REQUIREMENTS 3.1. Form of Tender – completed Tender Form (Appendix C) signed by an authorised signatory. 3.2. Technical Proposal – including Method Statements, Programme (Gantt chart), Quality Assurance Plan, Health & Safety Plan and Environmental Management Plan. 3.3.
